contentrichtext.text: {{infobox UK place| |country = Scotland |latitude= 58.20 |longitude= -6.74 |official_name= Callanish |gaelic_name= Calanais |population = |unitary_scotland= [[Na h-Eileanan Siar]] |lieutenancy_scotland= [[Western Isles]] |constituency_westminster= [[Na h-Eileanan an Iar (UK Parliament constituency)|Na h-Eileanan an Iar]] |constituency_scottish_parliament= [[Na h-Eileanan an Iar (Scottish Parliament constituency)|Na h-Eileanan an Iar]] |post_town= ISLE OF LEWIS |postcode_district = HS2 |postcode_area= HS |dial_code= 01851 |os_grid_reference= NB 215 332 }} '''Callanish''' ({{lang-gd|'''Calanais'''}}) is a village (township) on the West Side of the [[Lewis|Isle of Lewis]], in the [[Outer Hebrides]] (Western Isles), [[Scotland]]. A linear settlement with a [[jetty]], it is situated on a headland jutting into [[Loch Roag]], a [[Loch|sea loch]]. It lies 13 miles west of [[Stornoway, Outer Hebrides|Stornoway]]. Calanais is the location of the [[Callanish Stones]], a cross-shaped setting of [[standing stone]]s erected around 2000 BC, one of the most spectacular [[megalith]]ic monuments in Scotland. There is a modern visitor centre which provides information about the main circle and several other lesser monuments nearby. [[Image:Callanish standing stones 1.jpg|left|thumb|Callanish Standing stones, Outer Hebrides]] ==External links== * [http://www.callanishvisitorcentre.co.uk/ Calanais Visitor Centre] * [http://www.breasclete.com Breasclete Community Association (local area's website)] * [http://robinwilson.net/callanish/ Panoramas of the Callanish Standing Stones] (QuickTime required) {{Commons|Callanish}} {{Lewis and Harris}} it erected from the ground in 2000bc [[Category:Lewis]] [[Category:Villages in the Outer Hebrides]]
